title: Shelley Duvall: the rise and fall of The Shining’s troubled star
text:
This week, Doctor Sleep will revive all manner of vaguely terrifying thoughts about The Shining. The film, which is also based on a Stephen King novel, acts as a sequel to Stanley Kubrick’s revolutionary 1980 horror. Doctor Sleep has a high bar to reach, on many levels, but there will be one figure absent from The Overlook Hotel who will be sorely missed by some: Shelley Duvall.

For Duvall, The Shining proved life-changing. The actress was in her late twenties when Kubrick cast her in the film, by which point she had made something of a name for herself as an actress.
